title: Daniel Stendel downs tequila shots with Barnsley fans days after being sacked by club
text:
Daniel Stendel was downing shots of tequila with Barnsley fans on Wednesday night just hours after being sacked by the club.

The German manager was hailed 'a legend' as he was cheered on by a group of supporters at the Garrison bar in Barnsley.

Stendel was seen seeing off the shot before hugging a fan in the clip uploaded to social media.

Daniel Stendel down tequila shots with Barnsley fans just days after he was sacked by the club

Stendel winces after doing the shot before hugging one of the Barnsley supporters at the bar

Fans had chipped in to give Stendel an unofficial leaving party to thank him for his service before he heads back to Germany.

DANIEL STENDEL'S TIME AT BARNSLEY Games: 65 Wins: 32 Draws: 16 Defeats: 17 Win Ratio: 49.2 Won promotion from League One after finishing second with 91 points.

The 45-year-old remains an immensely popular figure among supporters, having guided them to promotion from League One last season.

He found life tough in the Championship though and was dismissed from his position on Tuesday following an abysmal start to the campaign.

The south Yorkshire club sit second bottom of the Championship table having won just one of their 11 league matches so far.

A 5-1 defeat at home to Preston on Saturday proved to be the last straw for Stendel despite the majority of fans wishing for him to stay.

Barnsley head coach Daniel Stendel has left the club with immediate effect

Barnsley sit second bottom in the Championship, two points adrift of safety, after 11 games

One fan wrote on Twitter: 'Love the bloke. Absolutely mortified.' While another joked 'he should be re-appointed for that.'

As Sportsmail revealed this week, Motherwell's Stephen Robinson has emerged as the frontrunner to replace Stendel.

The Northern Irishman has led Motherwell to third place in the Scottish Premiership this season and it is understood he is under serious consideration by the Barnsley owners.
